bow: during labor is there an urge to scream or make noise removed removed do scream just let out low moan that can get loud depending on the contraction just basically long ooohhhhh each time it did make much sound other that breathing not usually very loud person though only kind of yelled at my husband to shut up but other than that quiet no screaming just uhhhhhhrgs and more of groan guess it hurts so bad could have screamed if wanted to through rough contractions moaned not too loudly because was trying to focus on my breathing and such got an epidural at 5cm and it only worked on the right side of my body then completely wore off during transition at 7cm that when the yelling screaming started because was on pitocin and dilating rapidly was nearly silent during pushing to focus my energy on getting my daughter out efficiently my neighbors could definitely hear me screaming in the hour and half between 7cm and 5cm dilation but did really care surprisingly normally am loud person even as an adult sometimes reminded to use my indoor voice but was completely silent during labour apart from heavy breathing my natural reaction to pain is to be quiet and breath it away though so guess that helped during labour not at all for me just like trying to push out big poop grunts screamed when she ripped through but other than that there was no screaming just moaning and panting would say scream hum through contractions to kind of distract myself then when my body started pushing it turned into loud hgrmmmmaaghhh skipped the epidural but used nitrous the last leg of labor it was nice knowing could muffle myself with the mask had super deep loud moan that came out when was having tough contractions it somehow just happened naturally and some how helped me get through it cursed lot do really remember but do think made that much noise before got an epidural more of suffer in silence type though whimpered no yelling or moaning just sad and pitiful whiney whimpering cried lot during actual labor but no real screams when was pushing definitely groaned the whole time but nothing too loud it would be awful to be told had to be silent though first labor epidural no screaming second labor no epidural not by choice so that might have something to do with it lots of screaming mostly wanted to hold my breath which was what *should ve* been doing my friend nurse had to keep getting onto me about making sure to breathe by the end did want to make noise but not yelling it was more of louder exhale moan the lady in the room next door she was screamer was silent 98 of the time said owie as he crowned my midwife laughed little also refused to open my eyes and got really mad when they shut the jets off in the tub screaming and keeping my eyes open would have taken more energy than had at that point was told that made lot of noise the doctor encouraged me to to help me remember to keep breathing for as much as curse all other times do think cursed during that well one eff bomb when the doctor stitched me back up removed no but then again quiet person the nurses seemed to really appreciate it but it also meant they never checked on me and were shocked when was ready to push so in essence scream if you want or not whatever makes you feel better gt the nurses seemed to really appreciate it yeah also learned in my cross cultural healthcare class that nurses generally value stoicness in patients giving birth yeah there are studies that show that cursing helps to relieve pain haha gt cried lot during actual labor but no real screams learning about the amount of suffering most women endure during labor makes me sad am very quiet during labor no screaming no loud anything with the exception of loudly saying obviously or something when someone asked if was having contraction once labor progressed did natural no meds childbirth by the time was done being hero it was too late and could get an epidural and did some serious primal screaming it was cathartic though and the hospital did mind that was before started pushing though once started pushing it was mostly loud grunts did scream with either of mine my first was very rough labor and toward the end could actually remember if was really in labor or of it was bad dream and my husband says my face was completely white and kept asking the nurse please it kind of scared him because he could figure out what was asking for my second was much easier labor and just moaned when needed to make noise besides that was quiet and just concentrating really hard mostly grunted but at the last bit of pushing screamed so loud that my sisters heard from the hall removed just wanted to curl up and cry also break daddys hand cause was afraid he leave was so glad for that epidural think laughed good bit after that cause two nurses had to hold my legs and it was hilarious and embarrassing removed stayed very quiet during labor only said ok ok ok during contraction this was half telling everyone around ok and telling myself everything is going to be ok as got further into the pushing part found that if started talking it was all negative and counter productive if was quiet my thoughts were positive focused and disconnected from reality was cracking jokes in my head like was watching tv making noises is totally normal and natural my only suggestion is to make low noises and keep your lips mouth jaw relaxed and loose according to ina may gaskin you ca keep tight mouth and relaxed pelvic floor removed yeah they were all but rolling their eyes when another patient was screaming and mumbling that why you get the epidural kind of thought it was bs but if you are screaming you ca hear their instructions and they are trying to help you imagine it gets really frustrating for them with my first yelled and screamed and cursed with my second think was more prepared and my epidural worked much better than the first so did get as much of an urge to yell it my understanding that epidurals usually do make childbirth completely painless they make it less painful but oftentimes the pain of childbirth is soooooo excruciating that even less painful is still really painful that not even bringing up how for many women epidurals can have bad side effects that effect them for weeks if not months after birth feel really sad learning about the level of pain most women endure during childbirth it heartbreaking for me so think it mean to just roll your eyes at laboring woman screams think they should have some empathy if they ca respect that some women may scream in response to what is often *the most painful experience of their lives* then maybe they should be nurses hearing about the suffering many women endure during childbirth is heartbreaking for me hope that it was all worth it afterwards amp that the level of positive emotions helped to make up for the level of pain and suffering yes found weirdly had zero control over the sounds that were coming out of my mouth labor is loud was like shrieking banshee apparently in those cultures making noises during childbirth is considered shameful that makes me sad making noises during what is often *the most painful experience of person life* should not be something to be ashamed of for me it was howling oooooooooooooooooooooo but once the epidural kicked in felt nothing wore my sunglasses and made jokes to the staff during the whole process good times modern medicine is wonderful removed well be happy to have another kid so just asked my partner and we both agree that was pretty quiet talked some but calmly remember making some grunting pushing sounds when got down to pushing had an unmedicated birth with 10 lbs baby used hypnosis for childbirth which kept me super calm for the experience it was amazing my first was induced and since nobody told me that was horrific was like oh ll go all natural no epidural there was screaming first there was just some screaming and then when asked for the drugs that were supposed to make you care less about the pain it turned out those drugs just made me care less about what anyone else thought of my screaming sooooo many screams second kid was natural labor and that was more like high pitched whining and whimpering my first made some lower noises during contractions which grew as progressed my second made almost no noise except for when she was coming out roared like lion haha it does have to be pain just know that it is sensation that will take your entire focus to stay on top of keep relaxed keep your mouth relaxed have some humour about you welcome the intensity it ll be the greatest thing you ve ever done now feel really bad cause when it came time to push screamed yelled and told my husband he should be having the baby not sure how much they ended up giving me because the anesthesiologist had trainee and she fooled around for while they left felt nothing my awesome nurses were pissed think was pretty pitiful they came back finally the real guy did it and they told me was nowhere near pushing and that should try and sleep somewhere between 30 60 minutes later they came back to check and discovered could move my legs and was apparently *very* ready to push after that it was all kinda whirl of pushing and nervous giggles then she was born as for the side effects had to stay in the hospital at least an extra day because after she was born in could stop shaking they were afraid had an infection but told me later it was probably the epidural do feel bad different women deal with pain differently it completely understandable that woman would scream during what is often *the most painful experience of her life* screamed and swore whole lot seriously have the mouth of sailor every day all day and did utter one curse word the whole time my grandma was in complete shock was too focused on not barfing and then barfing it was more of sob moan than yell scream reaction for me perfect visual told my doctor afterwards it felt like just took biggest ever she said well you did did know it normal to poop during labor two of my three kids were born naturally no epidural having doula was the most amazing decision ever made for those two births deep down humming moaning helps the most my doula told me to focus on staying on top of the wave for some reason that was the most helpful piece of information she gave me focus on moaning keeping your body relaxed and not being taken over by the contraction never really screamed but it was close to screaming with the most intense contractions pre pushing at the start of hour of pushing screamed and proceeded to get yelled at by the nurse she said that not helpful and is wasting your energy it had been hours felt entitled to little yelling removed make the same noise during my first labour my nurse told me to try to make the sound sort of like when people meditate in cartoons ooooohm it just ended up sounding like long low uuuuuuuuh but the vibration my voice made felt nice definitely helps focus and reduces pain the joy of meeting that little bugger who been kicking your ribs the past few months is like the memory erasing pen in men in black that mean of her same here an ohhhhhhhh tone eventually yelled as loudly as possible somehow yelling pushed the pain back drowned it out basically none of the other labor techniques worked for me if could make sound would have gone nuts or demanded an epidural from the beginning my mom and husband told me sounded like an opera singer do remember it though everyone was little freaked out about how silent was while was laboring and pushing my ils were waiting outside and were afraid something was wrong and the nurses kept checking my oxygen because they were sure was about to pass out honestly have very little memory of what was happening while was pushing just remember being focused but also the kind of person who will remain silent when stub my toe or something just not vocal person said the same thing while she was crowning felt the ring of fire and kept saying okay okay okay and it was mostly to remind myself that was okay when my baby was crowning it was soooo painful could have stayed silent removed ended up being induced and only made it to 6cm before my daughter needed our in an emergency csection not sure say had an urge to make noises done lot of yoga and meditation in preparation for labour had no pain killers so was vocalising humming and visualising my cervix opening did have doosy of double peak contraction that let out and involuntary moan my husband at one point said my humming was annoying was like what really the one going through this ll do whatever the hell want definitely had the urge to stand up and move around the hardest thing ve ever done in my life was when my daughter go in distress and they needed me to lie still on the bed while they attached scalp monitor to her contractions are 1000 worse lying down my whole body was screaming at me to stand up or at least roll over was also difficult to stay on the damn bed as they rushed me to theatre but atleast was able to rock from side to side bit do feel bit cheated out of labour feel like my humming and visualisation could have gotten me much further but put my daughter life first and let them knock me out and cut me open my epidural was *perfect* as soon as it hit my endorphins kicked in felt amazing zero pain could still feel baby moving and could feel my contractions was worried because my sister had been able to feel hers and someone had to tell her when to push worst pain of my entire life before the epidural but it absolutely did its job oh man was doing that and the nurses told my husband was panicking and to get me to stop making noises and just focus on breathing was so angry at them bc their way only made things worse but my contractions were one on top of the other and could not catch moment to actually speak to tell them knew what was doing made longgggg shhhhh noise through every contraction when did it naturally it seems totally possible to be quiet but silent it would be hard had two unmedicated labors although the second was an induction pretty quiet until it time to push then turn into screamer was more verbal with the first was cursing and remember yelling get it out get it out get it out at one point lol with the second it was more moaning and yelling ahhhhhhhh screamed and also made some very primal animal sounds apparently lower pitched moaning is better than shrieks so my husband and midwife kept me on track with that as best they could also apparently labouring made me sound like mammal according to my husband haha this was natural homebirth wonder if in those cultures maybe birth is more normalized and women have grown up seeing many births so they might have an easier time being quiet imagine their birth traditions support the labouring mom in ways to help her stay mostly it hurt pretty damn bad labored for 40 hours went without epidural for 32 of those did make any noise until the pushing started and at that point started exhaling very loudly and kinda yelling hospital sent me home twice on my third trip in arrived at 12:07 am and gave birth at 12:27 am so there was no time for any sort of examination let alone pain medication threw off my clothes squatted
